codeChain

Class CodeChain

  • java.lang.Object
    • codeChain.CodeChain

  • public class CodeChain
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Kai Wang. A chain of code that will be executed in order. Assumption: All the data used in the block of code chain should be either parsed to the code chain as initial arguments, or the results from the previous block. Otherwise an ArgumentTypeException will be thrown upon execution

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CodeChain() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void buildBlock(java.util.List<java.lang.Class<?>> neededArgumentTypes, java.util.function.Function<ArgumentMap,ArgumentMap> code)
      Build a block and add it to the code chain
      ArgumentMap execute(ArgumentMap arguments)
      Execute the entire code chain, the final result will be the result of the last block

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • CodeChain

        public CodeChain()

    • Method Detail

      • buildBlock

        public void buildBlock(java.util.List<java.lang.Class<?>> neededArgumentTypes,
                       java.util.function.Function<ArgumentMap,ArgumentMap> code)
        Build a block and add it to the code chain
        Parameters:
        neededArgumentTypes - the argument types that will be used in the code
        code - the implementation of this block

      • execute

        public ArgumentMap execute(ArgumentMap arguments)
                    throws ArgumentTypeException
        Execute the entire code chain, the final result will be the result of the last block
        Parameters:
        arguments - The initial arguments for the code chain
        Returns:
        the final result of the code chain
        Throws:
        ArgumentTypeException - if any block of the code chain use data that do not exist in the code chain
